pageContext.claim: “Thank you to Rasmussen for the honest polling. Just hit 50%, which is higher than Cheatin’ Obama at the same time in his Administration.”
pageContext.analysis: On April 3, 2010, Obama had a 46 percent approval rating in the Rasmussen poll, which is right-leaning and tends to rate Republicans higher than average. Focusing on one poll is not very informative. The 538 average has Trump at a 40.4 percent approval rating on April 3, 2018, compared to 48.3 percent for Obama on April 3, 2010.
